column4: Hi, I'm trying to get my ATI to use the ATI rendering libraries rather than the Mesa ones so I can use direct rendering.  I've followed a load of tutorials on google but still not using the ati libs.  I thought I'd try removing libgl1-mesa-dri but it wants to get rid of x-window-system-core.  Is that just a meta package or is that quite dangerous to get rid of?
are you using the ati-kernel-module?
I believe the tutorials got me isntalling linux-restricted-modules... and xorg-driver-fglrx
yes
have you edited your xorg.conf after that?
yeah i did aticonfig --initial and made sure all the Driver bits in the Device sections were fglrx
the position of the image on the screen shifted horizontally slightly too so I think it did so something.
have you restarted X?
many times, rebooted the whole PC too
ok...and then you did what to check if it works?
first I checked fglrxinfo for what Libraries it was using (said all Mesa, think it should be all ATI), then I checked glxinfo to see whether the 'Direct Rendering' line said yes (it said no)
and you have no problems when starting X?
no,  none that I'm aware of at least
I have the ATI Drivers off their site now, you think its worth me trying them out?  Could be a bug in the dapper package maybe?
that's strange...
I'm using the dapper ones, and they work beautifully
maybe check again if all necessary drivers and modules are installed, and have a look at xorg.conf again
maybe dmesg gives some ihnt
hint
oh lots of errors in dmesg just seen
dmesg | grep fglrx puts 8 [17181093.744000]  [fglrx:firegl_unlock]  *ERROR* Process 7354 using kernel context 0, all different process numbers
maybe you can google for that...I cannot help you, sorry.
ok, well thanks.  Hopefully I'll get it sorted soon, then I can play with compiz :)
you're welcome....
